subject: Re: [junit] Using DataSource
msgSnippet: ... Are you testing the JNDI lookup? Are you worried you re not doing the lookup correctly? ... It s a good one, depending on what you re trying to test. -- J.
messageBody:
rvdamle wrote:

> The code I am trying to test uses JNDI lookup for Datasource etc.
> How do I test this code from JUnit?

Are you testing the JNDI lookup? Are you worried you're not doing the
lookup correctly?

> I guess, I need to separate DB connection logic from my domain classes
> and test them from Junit by passing appropriate connection objects.
>
> Is this the correct approach?

It's a good one, depending on what you're trying to test.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
